intro: Roccardia anthemoides, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Roccardia anthemoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
